name: ARIA Resort & Casino

reviews.text: I'm a business traveler whose on the road more than 50% of the time, so staying at a hotel where you're comfortable is key. To say I was comfortable at this hotel is putting it midly. I big proponent of new. And this place is only abt a year old. This hotel has completely shifted my thoughts on what nice is. The lighting, the city views, the touch pad operation of all things in the room, completely blew me away. And to say I fell in love with the "good night" button is putting it midly. I was huge fan of this place. Not to mention all that it has to offer from a restaurant perspective. I never had a need to leave the hotel at all. The only minor quirk that I had abt the hotel was the fact that they didn't have any outlet plugs close to the bed (for those of you who prefer working in bed versus the desk). Other that, I completely loved my stay. I will say that the check-in and check out lines were a complete mess, but I enjoyed my stay in the room so much that I completely overlooked the madness. I've sung the Aria's praises all week. It was quite dreadful when I had to stay at another Vegas hotel the next week due to a convention. Needless to say it paled it comparisons. They'd literally have to burn down the Monte Carlo and build again to be on the same level as the Aria.
reviews.title: I'm positive this is what heaven is like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So the wife and I finally broke down and stayed at ARIA - we've stayed at pretty much everywhere else on the Strip, and wanted to give ARIA a shot after it opened up last year. We ended up going with her family as well right after Christmas, in between Christmas and New Year's, so we had a good couple of days.
reviews.title: Teething Issues - One Year Later?

reviews.text: Our overall impression was that the hotel has a ton of potential - but for some reason, the staff still isn't quite executing the vision of the hotel. It's a shame, really - it's dragging down what is otherwise a very lovely hotel. Upon checking in, we quickly realized we'd been put in a smoking room, so had to call downstairs to get another room. I figured I'd have to go downstairs (yet again) to swap keys, but nope - just had to jot down the room number over the phone and walk in to the new room. The keycard worked in the new place immediately. So, that was nice - not so nice was winding up in a smoking room to start with.
reviews.title: DONT EVER STAY HERE YOU WILL BE SORRY !

reviews.text: The 'free' wireless internet was included in a daily resort fee - fine, I suppose, since I always use the internet - although it would be nice if the wireless internet actually, y'know, worked. It rarely connected in our room and when it did it was mind-numbingly slow. You could connect to the 'wired; internet for free - but only if you happened to bring your own RJ-45 ethernet cable to connect, otherwise you were more than welcome to use the hotel's provided "Internet Amenity Kit", provided for the low-low price of $20. Ahem.
reviews.title: Beware of dishonest cleaning Staff - Our money got stolen in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The electronics in the rooms are pretty nice, all told - there's a bedside touchscreen that basically controls the room. Ours worked....when it wanted to, which is a way of saying, not very often. Pressing the "Close Curtains" button would often only work for a few feet, and then you'd have to mash it again....and again....anyways, you get the idea. Again, great idea - poor execution.
reviews.title: Overall, it was a good stay but the hotel is showing signs of employee guest service training issues.

reviews.text: This hotel/casino wants to differentiate itself from all the others by being completely 'green'. I can't see why and I can't find out what there is in the hotel that is more green than others. Anyway. The place is located on the South part of the strip and close to Bellagio and Montecarlo.
reviews.title: Massive property like many others

reviews.text: Check in took ages, with a line that was as long as an average airline check in... but the guy behind the desk was very friendly.
reviews.title: My kinda place!

reviews.text: Rooms are good and with nice views.
reviews.title: Touch of class in Vegas.

reviews.text: Two downsides: there was no coffee maker, which I really missed during my stay, as there is no real restaurant/coffee place here. It takes a while to wander around downstairs and in between the slotmachines and roulette tables there are some restaurants, but I just wanted a cup of coffee and all other US hotels generally have coffee makers
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: Other downside: a lot of chloride in the water. I took a bath and it really smelled. Must be the Nevada/Las Vegas water supply so maybe not an Araia specific issue. Don't know really
reviews.title: Very Clean!

reviews.text: I have just spent four nights at the Aria with my wife. The room, cleanliness, and service were exceptional.
reviews.title: Excellent value and top notch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have read the reviews that others have written on this hotel and can only respond that we did not experience any of the problems
reviews.title: Modern, Fresh, and Fun!

reviews.text: mentioned.
reviews.title: Beautiful and quiet

reviews.text: In contrast it was a wonderful experience
reviews.title: A terrible beauty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Aria on the 3rd week of Jan. We are in our late 30's and like to gamble, have a few cocktails, and stay in a modern comfortable quite room. The Aria provided everything we were looking for on our Las Vegas trip. The check in area is huge and stunning. The people at the counter were accomadating and efficient. Before we were able to get onto the elevator we had to show our room card to a security gaurd standing in the hall before the elevators. I thought that was great. When we got into our room we were extrememly pleased on the modern upscale decor. Flat panel T.V. that allowed you to control everything in the room from the temperature to the opening of the curtains. Our view of the Manderan hotel and the strip was awesome. The washroom was just the right size with a double sink and a great shower. The best part of the room was the amazing bed!! Once you lied down it was hard to get out of it. 24hrs. room service was fast and delicious. The Skybox Restaurant is good for a quick bite and a beer. I highly recommend the Prime Rib burger!! The Casino seemed small compared to other hotels, but was nice and there were alot of $10 tables throughout the day and night. The location of the Hotel was great. It is located between the Monte Carlo and The Cosmopolitan. Friends of ours stayed at the Bellagio and the walk was about 10 mins.(they thought our hotel was much better) One other thing, which may be important to some but not others, was the wat the Aria pumped in a Vanilla type smell, it didn't smell like an ashtray which some others do. My wife and I both agreed that the Aria will be the hotel we go to from now on. Check out the Spa for $30 a day.
reviews.title: Shiny new hotel, poor service & suspected bed bugs

reviews.text: We stayed at the Aria Oct 29-31 and loved it. My mom actually had 3 nights free from all the comp points she earned on the last trip from the casino! The casino goes on forever, the beds are the very best I've slept in (must be some sort of new memory foam??) Wow! Everything is controlled in the room from your little ipad-like alarm clock, and things turn on and open the drapes as you enter the room. It was all ultra modern and yet cozy in neutral colors with some greens and blues. The only downfall was that they didn't let me check in when I got there 8 hours before the rest of my group because I technically wasn't on the reservation. So, just make sure you put all of your group's names that will be in the room when you make the reservation! We ate a few restaurants in the hotel as well (I'll review those separately!) Awesome hotel, great service, though lost our money in the casino lol!!
reviews.title: Beautiful and modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times now. This has become our place to stay in Vegas. The rooms are beautiful, especially the corner suites. Floor to ceiling windows, modern decor. Remotes in each room that do almost everything for you, open curtains. Everywhere you go in this hotel the staff are very friendly. Large clean casino. Great restaurants. So much to do. A must stay.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: The Aria is an oasis of style in a desert of mediocre bling that is Vegas... the smartness is in direct contrast to the contrived tack of the themed biggies which seem to rule the roost there. Tourists flock in with conditioned notions of Venetians and Bellagios and New York New Yorks, but the Aria scores much higher in my book. The rooms are designed for comfort and convenience, the common areas are beautifully done, and the staff conduct proceedings with courtesy and an attitude to cater to your wishes. Dont miss the spa, which is a steal at the daily price, and will rejuvenate you. The restaurants provide food that is as well prepared as it is presented. (Try the banana cream pie). Location couldnt be better. A true relief from Vegas overkill !!
reviews.title: Aria Scores High

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay at the Aria which is quickly becoming our new favorite resort in Las Vegas. Our first stay was right after it had opened and we didn't have a very good impression at that time, but we gave it another try in May of this year and were pleasantly surprised by how well the resort had come together. When we decided on another weekend in Vegas this past month we once again chose the Aria and were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Modern, Classy and Fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Aria is an ultra modern glass and steel creation with exquisite and varying marble floors throughout. This does tend to give it an austere feel at times but mix in a casino, night life and your usual Las Vegas crowd and that quickly goes.
reviews.title: Luxurious & Opulent

reviews.text: I love this hotel! My husband and my in-laws love it too!
reviews.title: Loved it! A Lot!

reviews.text: This is one of the LEED Gold buildings of the City Centre, I feel it is important to choose a hotel that has sustainability awareness.
reviews.title: Great but is it really worth it???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next time going back to Vegas, I will either book this or try the Vdara.
reviews.title: Great Stay Oct. 28th - 29th

reviews.text: The hotel is absolutely beautiful, and it smells sooooooooo good. I actually went to their shop and bought the scent stick that has the Aria smell. Service is superb. When I check in, I picked a line that the front desk person is in training. It is actually his third day of work, yet, I think he was doing amazing. It was a bit slow, but I am on vacation, I have no problem be in his line for a little wait to help him with his training!
reviews.title: Loved Aria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We called for service several times, and it all went well.
reviews.title: Five stars all the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel! I loved the way it smelled, kinda weird but that's one thing you remember. The service was good however I did not like the way you check in, there are no lines during the weekdays. You just stand behind someone, we got stuck behind someone who took forever so we watched about 4 couples check in before we even got up to the counter. They did set up ropes on Friday for people checking in/out so I guess they only do that on the weekend days. That's really only the complaint I had so not too big of a deal. I loved the room, we had a pool view on the 15th floor. The bed is very comfortable and the bathroom was very nice. I do wish they would put a usable mini fridge in the room, but again no big deal.The only fridge is full of food/drinks you have to buy AND they are on a scale so don't touch unless you want to pay 55 bucks for a candy bar. We only ate at the buffet for lunch when we arrived and it was great. That was about 20 bucks a person but they have sooo much food. The drinks were some of the better ones I had on the strip. The pools were nice, not too many people when we were there and there were plenty of chairs. If I ever go back to Vegas this hotel will definitely be my first choice!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel recently for a 4 night stay. The property location is right in the middle of the strip. Las Vegas is one of my favorite vacation destinations having been there a dozen times.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: While I will admit the Aria wasn't my favorite place to stay, it still is a 5 star resort. The staff from the time we checked in to the house keeping staff were outstanding. The hotel has the best dining choices. The pool was very nice and clean and not overly crowded. I am very particular when it comes to cleanliness, and I am happy to say the room exceeded my expectations!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bottom line the Aria is a wonderful resort and I would stay at this beautiful hotel.
reviews.title: The Best!!!

reviews.text: I've just returned from the Aria. The hotel is beautiful, the service excellent. The location is very good, but you must take the tram to the giant Bellagio and walk from there. I found the rooms to be a little small, but very well equipped.
reviews.title: Great place in Las Vegas

reviews.text: My company hosted our annual conference at the Aria last week. The place is beautiful for sure and the room are high-tech. Remote control everything - curtains, tv, lights...
reviews.title: Beautiful place, amazing rooms
Very happy, and would stay again next time
reviews.text: Bathrooms were well equipped too - nice deep tub and shower stall. Spacious counter tops too in the bath room.
It was unfortunate that their front desk systems were down most of the week - I still haven't gotten my final bill and I have been home for 5 days now. This could be interesting.
reviews.title: Great location, customer service at check in very poor, on our honeymoon and first night completely ruined!

reviews.text: We had 6 nights in Vegas (first time there) and wanted to book 3 nights, then look around to see what else we could find. Came across Aria and found its prices extremely reasonable for such a lovely and modern style hotel. It was definitely a younger persons hotel ie 25-45 with its modern look, facilities and shops in comparison to our previous hotel which was lovely but more Italian style with an antique feel and higher rates. We didnt require much in the way of service, however what we needed was provided in a friendly and professional manner. Would definitely choose Aria on our next stay for its value for money.
reviews.title: Aria Las Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Aria after a 14 hour trip from the UK on Thursday, our honeymoon that we had saved long and hard for. It was 5pm in Vegas and we had been awake for almost 24hrs. When we arrived we were informed by people at the door that the computers were down so check in would be anything up to 1hr 30mins. We joined the queue like everyone else and waited. The most frustrating thing was that there were people shouting and complaining who seemed to get treated like royalty and moved to the front of the queue then us typical Brits who had good reason to complain after almost 24 hrs awake who just stood and waited. We eventually got to the front of the queue 2.5 hours later. The girl who checked us in was rude and couldn't even manage a smile. I know she had probably had a tough day but so had we. We had been promised a welcome gift to the room by the travel agents which the lady at the check in desk confirmed, I also asked to speak to someone more senior as I was unhappy with the $50 room credit offered for such a long wait I was promised a phonecall from the manager and the welcome gift the next day. It didn't happen.
reviews.title: A New hotel in Las Vegas Good but not Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very well kept. Very helpful staff. Large room with nice strip view.
reviews.title: We'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Aria from June 06-11 in a city view single room. We loved everything about the place. The room controls are very easy to operate and I am not very technically inclined. Great view of the strip. Room number was 17032 and the area was very quiet. No issues with the shower/bathtub combination whatsoever.
reviews.title: Very Pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited the pool area three times and even in the middle of the afternoon there was an adequate number of available loungers. Drink service was good, and the drinks are a little high, but you are in Vegas, I didn't have a problem with it.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: Was very pleased with the friendliness and overall professionalism of every staff member we encountered. I like the security personnel in the elevator areas on the casino and promenade level.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel lacking in customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cafe Vettro is good food at what I consider reasonable prices. I do think that they need to decrease the size of the area that the waiters are responsible for, however. Buffet was good at breakfast the one time we ate there.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was incredible. The rooms were the most advanced I have ever seen. As soon as we walked in, the curtains opened for us and the lights turned on! The furnishings were beautiful, and the cleaning staff was ridiculously meticulous. We had change lying on the dresser and they neatly stacked it in piles for us. The beds were also very comfortable.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel

reviews.text: The pool area was very nice, and although it was too cold to enjoy the pools, we did use the hot tubs.
reviews.title: A great experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was that you weren't allowed to put your own things in the fridge in the room, and it would have been nice to keep drinks cold.
reviews.title: Aria Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise, fantastic hotel!
reviews.title: Aria - Vegas

reviews.text: When I stay in a hotel, I normally try not to return when I visit the same city again. Not with Aria. I would stay in that place again. The best part is the floor to ceiling window that shows the majestic view of the mountains. The facilities are exceptional and state-of-the art especially the spa. The restaurants are world class. The staff are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Jan - 2013 - Visit with Joe and Thomas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our stay at Aria and would most defiantly go back. We arrived Sat. around 11:30-12 p.m. there was 1 person in front of our line to check in. I was actually worried about checking in based on the reviews I had read. No issue at all. It was quick and painless. The smell everyone talks about is so sweet and warm! Smells like a big vanilla cookie the hotel... The hotel does charge a $25 resort fee which includes your WiFi, gym, etc.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel and great service!!! Would go back...

reviews.text: Room was very nice, modern and chic. We actually were upgraded to a strip view room for our anniversary and the hotel put chocolate covered strawberries and chocolate covered coconut macaroons (which were delish)..Yes everything can be done by the remote next to your bed which was very high techy and could be pain late at night after drinking but there is also switches on the walls. The beds were to die for. I slept like an angel on the big comfy bed!!! Safe in the draw next to bed. Do not touch mini fridge or items for sale unless you plan on buying. You touch you buy...it is weight detected.
reviews.title: Could not have been any better

reviews.text: The bathroom was nice. Separate toilet area enclosed with a door, shower and tub in another glass room in bathroom. They do provide robes in your closet.
reviews.title: Could be 5 stars easily

reviews.text: We ordered room service one night - French toast with fresh whipped cream and berries (beautifully presented I must add) and pizza. It was up to our room in a half hour and was really good. The cost was $50- but it was late at night and the comfort of delivery to our room was worth it not to mention it was actually really good. We ate the buffet for breakfast one day and that was really good too. Everything you can think of they have. Price is $18.pp plus you can add on for mimosa's, ect. We ate at the Sports Box Cafe for lunch one day party of 4 bill was $100.00...we got burgers and sandwiches and 3 beers/1 soda. The food was very good.
reviews.title: A great addition to the Las Vegas Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cocktails at modesta bar are very very good. Their sour mix is made fresh...and their specialty drinks are very good. Overall I can't complain the food was good...even the house blend coffee (I'm a big Starbucks drinker - I like it bold and this was decent stuff).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good Location

reviews.text: Stayed at the Aria for a business conference. First time in Vegas.
reviews.title: wonderful, modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Smart and luxurious
ARIA SKY "SWEETS"-Living like The Jetson's
reviews.text: 1. Rooms are modern and feature all necessary amenities plus so many more. The tech system (carefully explained in other reviews) is helpful and fun. The bed is soft as are the pillows. Very comfortable for sleep.
2. The spa is fabulous! I had a wonderful massage. The service was impeccable. I highly recommend you get a spa treatment!
reviews.title: In love with Aria!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Lemongrass restaurant and catering at our conference on-site were very good.
reviews.title: Excellent at Aria!

reviews.text: The Aria in Las Vegas has been an extremely positive surprise. I stayed at this hotel for a company conference and was very impressed on all aspects of this stay. The hotel is located on the South Strip and therefore right in the vicinity of all you might want to see in Vegas. It is a very modern and appealing hotel, with nice outside waterfalls. It might not offer some of the spectacular sights like some of the other Las Vegas Hotels (namely the Bellagio, Paris Paris, New York or Venitian), but it still has a very rounded concept. This high rise beautifully illuminated hotel has over 4,000 rooms, but what service is concerned you would not notice.
reviews.title: Place to go in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in was extremely efficient and cordial. The rooms are large, very clean and offer state of the art amenities and technology. Touch screen devices manage every aspect of your room. The bathrooms are very large with extensive shower and bath facilites. I am in absolute awe about the greatness of these rooms.
reviews.title: Will not recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Besides the great rooms you find everything desireable in this hotel: nice pool, exquisite fitness facility, spa, great restaurants, appealing shops, Elvis Musical (though I did not visit it myself, colleagues told me it was great), and a nice casion environment, where the "cheap" Las Vegas does not shine through.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What the conference I attended is concerned I can only give the facilities and the staff an A plus. It was incredible how they managed and served 2.5K plus people and fed them without any problems. The night club "Haze" has also proven to be an incredible clubbing location which leaves nothing else to desire by providing a great night!
reviews.title: Will definitely be back

reviews.text: This Aria is definitely a keeper, and though I know I might be attending similar company conferences there in the next two years, it would definitely also be my choice on any private trip to LV.
reviews.title: Modern hotel on the Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Vegas. The location was definitely worth it because it was easily walkable to pretty much all hotels on the Strip. I had booked ahead of time with two separate reservations (two separate prices) and they were able to make sure that we didn't have to switch rooms or go through the checkout process twice which was really nice. The room itself was nice, but nothing special---nice bed, bathroom, etc. Two weird things---there was a panel to turn on the TV, lights, curtain which was really cool but didn't work for the TV that well and the minibar area was weighted so we were warned not to rest anything on top of it and then take it off because the weight difference might suggest we used the minibar. The spa, pool, and gym was totally worth it though!!
reviews.title: Good home base in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Aria hotel in July 2013. On arrival we were upgraded to a strip view room, which was beautiful! The view was incredible from the floor to ceiling windows; the room was so luxurious and the bathroom was very special!
reviews.title: INCREDIBLE!!

reviews.text: The service at the aria was 5 star; nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: #1 in las vegas

reviews.text: The pool areas are amazing; lined with palm trees, spotlessly clean and massive pools. Even though we visited at peak time, it never seemed too busy and it was never a problem getting a sunbed.
reviews.title: Not what I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No expense has been spared on this new swanky hotel; the casino, the impressive water features and extravagent displays in the lobby, made the stay very impressive.
reviews.title: Breathtaking and Beautiful

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this is an OK hotel. It's very clean. The staff are very nice. And the rooms are pretty nice. But I just don't like this place. It lacks the excitement of places like Bellagio, Venetian, and Encore. There are no breathtaking spaces here...just nice generic, ordinary architecture.
reviews.title: Aria - Tall, Boring, Soul-less

reviews.text: Worse, is the "Center". You'd think a place called City Center would actually HAVE a center. Well get this...the center is like a multi-storied freeway with cars speeding in and out. There's no restful, wonderful public space here. There's absolutely nothing memorable.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: You might think that with a name like "Aria", you might hear the occasional opera selection...or see music-themed decor. No dice. Everything, even the music is generic pop. The only theme here...is no theme...no soul. Just a building, nothing more.
reviews.title: Three time in one year!

reviews.text: Finally, the location is terrible. It's far away from everything else, and transportation is awful. It's not near any Express bus stop, and the Monorail is so far you can forget it. To compound this, the taxi lines are SUPER long all day.
reviews.title: Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm very sorry I spent $1,200 for 5 days here. All of City Center is worth a quick walk-through, and that's about it. Oh...and bring a huge wallet if you plan to shop here. The prices are all ultra high in all of the stores.
reviews.title: Nicest hotel on the strip!

reviews.text: Our recent stay at Aria was overall pretty good. The only complaint I would have is that they need to work on their front desk staff. There were 6 of us travelling together and when we checked in early morning we had asked that our rooms were on the same floor. The first person told us that wouldn't be a problem so after 45 minutes we walked away and waited for our text message to tell us our rooms were ready. We finally got the text, went to pick up our keys and were told that one room was located on the 17th floor, the second on the 29th floor and the third wasn't ready. After arguing for about 30 minutes they managed to get two rooms on the same floor and then promised us that the third room when it was ready would also be on the same floor. Again after the text was received that our room was ready we went to pick up the keys for the third room and were told that the room was on a totally different floor from the other two. Had to argue again with them and received no help what so ever. The manager was not very customer service oriented at all. The first time we asked to speak to the manager in the morning he didn't even bother to come over and see what the issue was. There was a different manager in the afternoon from the morning. We wouldn't have been so annoyed if we just hadn't been promised twice that we would be on the same floor. It was a very frsutrating start to our stay. I did however enjoy the rooms and the pool area.
reviews.title: Check In Nightmare

reviews.text: I booked a room at the Aria Resort and Casino because of its location, proximity to my favorite haunts on the Strip. The casino is smaller, which makes it easier to get from your room to the Boulevard. The rooms were comfortable. A little small, but the amazing bed, automatic curtains, and the nice bathroom compensated. I have never slept so well in a hotel. The linens were soft, the housekeeping prompt. It was semi-difficult to figure oput the little screen controls, but once I had everything programmed, it made life easier. I had free breakfast/lunch vouchers, but they were only valid until 11am, so I only made it once that week. The buffet was of average quality, with not a very diverse selection. The service in the buffet and the mimosas were wonderful. I would stay again. Pictures to come.
reviews.title: Aria is central on the Strip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited in October 2011. I have stayed at Caesars, Harrahs, Rio, Ballys, Hilton, Wynn and Venetion and can report the room was very nice. Almost as nice as Wynn, almost. My situation is I was offered 3 nights comped to us for a previous visit of very minimal casino play, a welcomed opportunity. The 200.00 casino play is much to do about nothing. You have to use your money to get the slot working with the free play and it is difficult to keep up with the play during the process and at the end, won nothing plus the money I put in I lost. Study the instructions before you do it. Second the 50. food credit was certainly required. Minimal dinner (small steak and she had a pasta dish) in the cafe was $80.00 but less the 50. credit now its down to market value. 1 coffee, 1 OJ and 2 yogurt parfaits were 26.00 for breakfast. Ouch. On the other hand the buffet was close to 40 a person but hey it was WORTH it and the best! Lobster, crab and everything imaginable. Fantastic. The only downside in this hotel is for older folks be prepared to walk walk and walk. Another downside its a heck of a walk to any other casino. The place is borderline to big. My girlfriend says incredible; I say very nice. I doubt I would stay there if I had to pay full price for the room, it would easily be a thousand dollar weekend just for hotel and food.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel but be aware of cost and size issues.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one fine hotel / casino. We upgraded to a corner suite for a 7 night stay and what a great decision that was. The service was immaculate and the room was amazing. The casino was classy and perfect after a night of site seeing. The beds are very comfortable and the team at the concierge always assisted with thoughtful insite. It was my birthday and a lovely birthday note and chocolate dipped strawberries were delivered to our room. The little extras in this hotel ensure that your visit will be a special one.
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.text: I have stayed at most hotels in the Vegas valley area. This hotel is pretty cool. The rooms are very nice with cool little style flairs. This hotel is meant more for couples. It does have decent restaurants and a cool club.
reviews.title: Pretty cool place

reviews.text: The hotel is very high tech. You control everything from a remote. Alarm opens the curtains. Very contemporary. Nice shops and restaurants. Casino is clean. Doesn't smell like musty old smoke.
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arias is a beautiful resort, I love the Decor.
reviews.title: Overall Good But...

reviews.text: The Staff was friendly and willing to help, the pool area was very nice and confortable.
reviews.title: Better on the second try
first class hotel
reviews.text: The Food at Julian serrano was great! however there was NO internet service!!! I was there for 5 days and I was unable to use the internet! this is the only but important down side of the hotel.

The first time I stayed at this hotel I wasn't as impressed. This time around I had a change of heart (maybe because our bathroom was cleaner). Aria is in a great location, where you can take a tram to Mirrage and Monte Carlo. This tram is free which is great if you dont want to do a lot of walking. The buffet here is decent (but not the best). The high 'techiness' of the room wares on you because sometimes the touch screen just doesn't work. All in all I would stay here again (although the resort fee is kinda high ~ 25 dollars a night).
reviews.title: Cool Hotel...Trendy

reviews.text: Spent a weekend here with friends. We didn't have any problems with staff or service. The room was a little bit smaller than I expected, but was otherwise very clean and comfortable. The hotel lobby had a very nice, refreshing fragrance that was a pleasant break from the casino. The buffet was fair. Had a good time at Club Haze. Spent some time by the pool and had no issues with ordering drinks. Hotel is in a great location right along the strip. Would love to return!
reviews.title: Elegant hotel on the strip

reviews.text: We stayed here for a medical conference from May 18th - May 23rd and, considering it is a 5 star hotel, was rather disappointed with their service.
reviews.title: Not exactly a stellar six-day stay...

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very nice and the rooms are spacious. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was big. However, their response to issues brought to their attention was disappointing.
reviews.title: I'd rather stay at the Wynn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the first day we noticed the television was not working. I brought it to the attention of the front desk more than once, and maintenance never came to fix it. It took multiple attempts just to bring it to their attention because each time I had a chance to call the front desk, I was placed on hold for an unreasonable amount of time. In addition, we noticed that housekeeping did not vacuum (or did not vacuum very thoroughly) during my 6-day stay. Perhaps their policy is to only vacuum when turning the room over for check-out?
reviews.title: Good stay and nice service

reviews.text: The location was convenient given the conference was being held at the Aria, but we can't say we'd would actually pay money to return for leisure travel.
reviews.title: good value-new rooms-good location

reviews.text: After reading reviews that were hit or miss on this place, I was lucky that it was a hit for me.
reviews.title: Aria is Ariaght

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: very high-tech. When you walk in, the tv turns on with some music, and the curtains open up so you can see the view. Everything is controlled by the tv remote. You can even check up-to-date flight status, adjust all the lights, curtains, etc. all on that remote. If you don't like all this technology, you might get frustrated, but I loved it. The regular rooms are not suites, and are sized as regular rooms, so keep that in mind. It's a decent size, but if you're used to other Vegas hotels and all rooms being suites, you'll think this room is small. Spacious closets, soft bath towels, large flat screen tv. The distance from the elevator to our room was quite a trek, and we weren't even at the end.
reviews.title: WOW!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bed: wow, what a soft and comfy bed. I believe it was a memory foam pillow top they have on the mattress. I had no problems falling asleep.
reviews.title: Fabulous, Modern, Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom: I heard this hotel is an eco-friendly green hotel. That being said, they have those sinks/faucets that spray the water out in a certain way. After using the sink, I looked around the counter and my clothes and it looked like a had a water fight with myself. It is a dual sink, and maybe I just have a lot of stuff, but there was barely enough counter space for 2 people. The toilet is separated from the rest of the bathroom by a frosted glass door and wall. So technically you can see a silhouette if someone else is in the bathroom with you. The shower head is awesome. To get to the tub, you have to go thru the shower, and I'm not really a fan of that, and that's just a personal preference. The amenities are the standard amenities, however, there was no cotton swabs or cotton balls.
reviews.title: Great Rooms, Unfriendly Staff, 5 Stars? Not in my opinion

reviews.text: Food: I did not eat at any of their establishments.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Cool Room, Best Night Sleep in a long time

reviews.text: I had really high expectations for this hotel. We had stayed at the Vdara previously, which is next to the Aria and part of the City Center property. Loved it there, but no casino. This trip we had my mom with us and she wanted to be able to go down the casino alone, so we chose Aria. We arrived very late on Thursday night. South valet entrance very confusing. We found valet, and walked in and checked in. Quick process. Were given NO information about anything. Basically - here are your rooms, here are your keys, the elevators are over there.. they wanted to upgrade the checkin software or something so she rushed us through the process. Ok.. so off we went. It was a bit of a hike over to the elevators, and it really was not very easy to find. We asked one of the cocktail waitresses and she pointed us in the right direction.
reviews.title: Nice Place, GREAT location

reviews.text: The casino is nice and open, and does not smell smokey even though you can smoke in there. So that is nice. More on the casino to come. Back to our first impressions. We arrived about 1pm, and were starving! We asked for ideas on where to eat - only place open 24 hours is the cafe. So we went upstairs to put our luggage in the rooms and then would go eat. We got to the rooms - very dark inside! There are no normal light switches. Everything is very high tech in the room, which turned out to be kind of fun, but for your first time in the room, it was very difficult to figure out how to turn on the lights. We turned on the light in the bathroom, and that helped us see the rest of the room. I used the flashlight on my phone to find the switch on the wall that let us turn some of the lights on, but they were all very dim. There is a tablet that you use to control everything! Lighting, room temp, curtains, tv, etc.. Once you get how it works, its fun, but I think there should be some sort of 'normal light' that you can just turn on with a normal switch - for first timers.
reviews.title: Beautiful place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was pretty, once we could see it. Very modern, browns and tans. There's lots of storage available. A desk, bar area, two chairs, bed, nightstands. The thing that bugged me the most about the room- there is a large refrigerator in the room, but you cant use it. It is filled with stuff they want you to buy. There is a small card on top of the bar area that warns of the $50 fee if you put any of your own stuff in the refrigerator. What? Why? Also if you take anything out of the frig, even to just look at it, you will be charged. So just ignore the refrigerator completely or it could cost you a fortune!!! I can see how people could get screwed big time because of this policy. That little card that explains the 'rules' is easy to miss.. I think this should have been explained at check in - but then again, she told us NOTHING.. So we drank our room temperature water during our stay. Weird, and slightly upsetting. Also, no coffee maker. So you have to go downstairs and wait in a long line in order to buy coffee. Annoying!
reviews.title: The best Hotel in Las Vegas

reviews.text: Bed was very soft. We prefer firm mattresses so we didnt find them comfortable, but my mom loved it. So its all what you prefer. Linens and towels were very nice. I also really liked the carpet - took a picture of it and may try to duplicate it for our house. The bathroom was fine. Very clean and slick. Weird, though. The bathtub is in the shower stall enclosure. They had a blow dryer in there and a magnifying mirror, too. I liked the smell of the soaps/shampoo/lotions. Room was clean, and everything worked well. We had a view of the Monte Carlo / Strip.
reviews.title: Stuffy Convention Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casino: Pretty nice as casinos go. Smelled better than most casinos. Was not very crowded. They did not have any $10 tables, everything was $15 and up. So we didnt play that night. Wanted to just sit and relax a bit, but didnt want to lose too much money that fast, so we skipped on it. Weird also that every employee we encountered was not very friendly. Not unfriendly, but not friendly or welcoming. Went to Bellagio the next day, they had tons of $10 tables - higher level of clientele, but still had more affordable tables.. And the place was packed :)
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.text: I was fortunately stuck in Vegas due to Irene and had to spend 4 extra days. So this gave me the opportunity to try this place for 2 days. I loved it. Did early check in with no hassle. Very friendly staff. The room was modern and had a very good view. Amenities were top notch.
reviews.title: Highly recommended.

reviews.text: I spent most of my time at the pool. Its not as crowded as Venetian or Bellagio. There were ample free seats. Also the palm trees provided much needed shade in the August sun. Poolside service was good, not great.
reviews.title: Attended a conference at this hotel - great food and convention center.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other pluses were on site restaurants, good security.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: I will definitely stay there again. Highly recommended for singles, families as well for business trips.
reviews.title: If you like Vegas, stay here

reviews.text: Although during a recent visit to Las Vegas for a conference, I did not stay at this hotel a number of my colleagues did, so I checked out the rooms and what I saw (and they agreed) the place is stunning. The views from both the 20th and 30th floor rooms are astounding. Rooms are beautifully appointed with everything from nice towels/amenities to automated drapery/tv/lighting. A friend referred to the rooms as the Starship Enterprise.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Service Could be Improved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were recommended this hotel by a friend for the first two nights of our honeymoon. We arrived Monday afternoon and were asked what we were there for, and of course I said, our honeymoon. The young lady at the desk lit up and went to work, our normal king room ended up becoming 2 nights in the Aria Sky Suites, a >1000 sq ft suite with 3 walls of glass looking off to the mountains, and a special concierge with free food and drinks. What an amazing experience!
reviews.title: Above and Beyond for our Honeymoon

reviews.text: Of note on the hotel itself, very new property perfectly located Center Strip, and the electronics of the room are incredible (controlling curtains, lighting, temperature, etc). After the way we were treated, we couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in Vegas.
reviews.title: Viva Las Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern , a man's dream côme thrugh. You control everything In the room with the remote of yourTV. Lights ,curtins ,air conditioned ,music , etc.. Beds are comfortable. You havé to show your key everywhere In thé hotel lots of controled areas. Pools are great. Staff is nice. Nô coffee In the room. View is superbe! You Will feel safe In This hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms, excellent staff, HORRIBLE check in/out

reviews.text: Aria is no doubt a gorgeous hotel. Pricey, but very nicely appointed and clean rooms. I can't say enough nice things about the baggage and bell team, housekeeping and the restaurant staff. Excellent cobb salad and amazing artwork like patries from Jean Philippe Patisserie on the casino level. BUT...the check in process was a nightmare. The system that the MGM resorts uses for reservations (Opera) went down on Tuesday and by the time we arrived on Thurday evening, it was still down. We had to wait in line for 2.5 hours to check in. We were offered only water and sodas, and no other compensation. Apparently this same issue has happened at least two other times before. The issue hit all the MGM resorts since they all use Opera. To add salt to the wound, on Sunday (5 days after the system issue began) we were unable to checkout from the room due and had to wait AGAIN through a very long checkout line. I travel to Vegas once a year and I will be looking for a non MGM resort next time, as the check in and check out wait time and management's response was completely unsatisfactory.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!

reviews.text: We stayed here Sept LY and I have just booked for 6 nights this Sept. I won't even bother looking at other options as this hotel was AMAZING! Very clean, great sized rooms, excellent gym (something that is really important to us, it has loads of both cardio and weights), great pools and it was always super easy to get a chair. Buffet lunch had tons of options.
reviews.title: Great beds, incredible view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just enjoying the art and decor at Aria is well worth the visit! Aria is a part of the new City Center complex in the middle of the south strip. The center includes casinos, high end malls, numerous restaurants as well as some of the most fabulous artwork and gallerys that I've ever experienced. Sign up for their Total Rewards club through Harrah's and you may even be surprised with a free room like we were! Room's are controlled via your TV or your bedside clock. Lighting, temperature, drapes, etc were all mastered from the comfort of our plush King Size bed. This hotel and City Center are well worth a visit even if you are just walking through!
reviews.title: This hotel had it ALL!

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Aria Resort and Casino in Las Vegas. We were sent a special invitation through the mail for 3 free night stays. The Aria is part of the MGM group of resorts. The rooms were exceptional and very modern. Upon entering our room the drapes opened automatically and the television turned on and welcomed us. The beds were great, the room plush and the service excellent. The buffet is also something I highly recommend. Excellent food and a large variety of choices. Everything is a bit pricey but this is a high class resort so we expected that. The casino slots were a bit tight and the table games were good. I would definitely return.
reviews.title: Very Impressed with Las Vegas' Aria Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Aria on our last trip to Las Vegas. As members of their players club we were offered a comp stay so we couldn't pass it up and went for my husband's birthday. Upon arrival our check-in was a breeze and we were off to our room. The room was large and we had a view of the mountains as well as the pool down below. Everything seemed to be in order or beyond as far as cleanliness goes; clean linens, bathroom, carpet. All of the employees we encountered (check-in clerk, housekeeping, the waitress at the cafe, casino staff) were courteous. I am definitely looking forward to our next visit to Aria!
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay!

reviews.text: I have no complaints about anything at the hotel per se, just that everything was really expensive! So, it's more a matter of where your priorities lie.
reviews.title: Very Nice, But Wouldn't Spend the Money To Stay Here Again

reviews.text: We're backpacker type people who don't mind staying in pension/hostel type places but also stay in nice place when travelling for work (and the company is footing the bill).
reviews.title: Beautiful and Best Beds-Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a great surprise and a very enjoyable experience. It is beautifully done and, although huge is size, has a comfortable and almost intimate feeling about it. The rooms are sound-proofed and the beds are plush and comfortable - I suffer from a bad back and can be very sensitive to new beds, but I always awoke feeling rested and without back pain each morning.
reviews.title: Most Relaxing Hotel on the Strip

reviews.text: The staff could not have been more gracious and friendly, from the check-in staff to the housekeepers to the bell men. Also, one doesn't feel lost in the vast casino as it seems to flow from one comfortably sized area to another effortlessly, with each area designed differently enough to make it feel like you've walked into a new room. The restaurants are top-notch, even the ones without a designer chef attached to their name.
reviews.title: A great stay - my favorite spot in Vegas

reviews.text: We inquired about possibly getting an upgrade from a standard room to a suite and were "comped" a corner suite n the 16th floor with views in three directions. The suite included a free-standing whirlpool bathtub situated in the triangular "point" where two of the windows met together, so it felt as if we were bathing in the clouds. At night, there was a lot of splendid lighting and motion from the surrounding strip, City Center and monorail visible through our windows, but not a sound came in through the glass or from neighboring rooms.
reviews.title: Plush and overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All draperies are electronically operated and can be controlled through either the wall panels or the remote control that operates the TV sets (one in each room, including the bathroom). The lighting (which is mostly soft and ambient) can also be controlled through the remote. When laying in bed at night watching the light show outside, you just need to push one bed-side button and all lights slowly dim out while the drapes close themselves.
reviews.title: Very Nice, but......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool areas (there are three pools) are as beautiful and well landscaped as any I have seen anywhere in the world. Compared to what we saw in other resorts, including the Bellagio and the Wynn, we felt that we could not have done any better than what we got at the Aria. It's just a different style; more clean and fresh and modern, and less of that hokey plastic fake-luxury decor of most of the other hotels. Each day we both remarked that there really wasn't much reason to ever leave this resort if we didn't want to. Everything we could want for a relaxing vacation was here and were were extremely happy with it.
reviews.title: Luxury meets ecology

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in, a truly five star hotel! Everything about this hotel is five star, the rooms are superb, the staff were so friendly and the facilities were excellent. Would definitely go back here again!
reviews.title: 40th wedding anniversary

reviews.text: The Front Desk is separated into different functional areas according to demand. When we checked-in, we were ushered from the check-in queues to the empty (but staffed) desk that were labelled as performing other functions. This was quickly reducing the large queues. Upon check-out, the experience was even better. We were approached by a staff member seconds after appearing in the lobby, and the staff completed our check-out quickly via iPad.
reviews.title: Queues quickly cleared

reviews.text: Queues are inevitable when visiting Las Vegas, but the iPad method was an innovative method to reducing them, and a good alternative to staff "queue combing".
reviews.title: An incredible property!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Aria this week and it is an incredible property. It is in a perfect area if you like to walk the strip. You can skip the taxi's if you want to shop, gamble and people watch.
reviews.title: Great hotel, superb location and excellent stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and everything is at your fingertips..literally! At your bed side table is a small touchscreen that controls your curtains, tv, lights etc. The bathroom was large and the soft amenities are what you would expect at a 5 Star/5 Diamond property. Service was excellent in the restarurant and I appreciated that the line staff would greet me and look me in the eye when I was walking around the hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!!

reviews.text: Sky Suite was exceptional. Dining choices and quality boggle the mind. Never felt crowded. Staff were knowledgeable, courteous and unobtrusive. Conveniently located, but you could never leave the property and be perfectly happy.
reviews.title: Unique in my experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has it all from the time you drive up to the time you leave. All of the las vegas hotels are charging a fee now which is separate from the room amount you think you are paying a little bit deceiving. It is very new and very flashy through out not like some of the older hotels that are looking aged now. It doesn't smell of cigarette smoke either which is nice. We ate in the hotel including breakfast, lunch and dinner all were great and a reasonable price. The negative is if you remove any thing from the room bar you will be charged $50 straight up they do tell you that when you arrive and there is a note in the room so beware expensive can of coke. It makes sense to us now that people were checking in had little coolers with them and cartons of beer. We had a great veiw from our room and we were upgraded. Very friendly and helpful staff at the front desk. Some beautiful shops there also you can buy almost any thing although most of the shops are upper class so you will pay more there. The hotel is in a very central position. Our room was great but our bed was very soft like way to soft to get a really comfy sleep. The negative the shower head is terrible no pressure what so ever they need to do some thing about that.
reviews.title: Very flash

reviews.text: I travelled to Las Vegas on business and stayed at the Aria hotel for 5 nights. This review comes from someone who would not normally choose to go to somewhere like Las Vegas, who doesn’t gamble or is into the glitz and glamour that is core to the Las Vegas experience. This hotel is enormous and to get to the bedrooms you need to walk through the casino area – there is no way of avoiding it. The hotel itself is very well run, clean, with comfortable good quality rooms, but everything is expensive, especially so for the US. This may be the case with all hotels of this standard in Las Vegas, I simply don’t know. Although the hotel has excellent conference facilities, it is more geared towards the holiday maker, with no proper desk chair in the room and no means of making a hot drink whilst working (unless you opt for the excruciatingly expensive room service option).
reviews.title: OK for business, probably better for leisure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern clean and efficient accommodation, fantastic views, the new Vegas! customer is king! Downside is everything is CHARGEBLE.
reviews.title: FABULOUS LAS VEGAS

reviews.text: Super views from high floors, strip or mountain view we plumbed for Strip
reviews.title: Conference

reviews.text: I stated at Aria April 26-29 fir my first trip to Vegas. We got a fab deal through Westjet! Our room was on the 27 floor overlooking the strip. The high attention to detail was amazing.
reviews.title: Fabulous, contemporary accommodation right in the middle of it all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We programed the room to wake us up by opening the blackout curtains. What a gentle way to wake up after a long night at the casino.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!

reviews.text: The whole place smells of vanilla. I was a bit worried about this because I have allergies but everything was fine.
reviews.title: A great addition to the Strip

reviews.text: We went to the spa which was gorgeous...exactly what a spa should look like. It is a bit on the pricey side but you pay for the ambiance.
reviews.title: The best in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools are like little oasis and you feel like you are on tropical vacation.
reviews.title: Chrome, steel and high tech

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very nervous about coming to the Aria since there are several bad reviews on this site I have been to Vegas 9 times and have stayed at the Wynn, Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Caesars, Bally's, and Planet Hollywood.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel- Don't understand the bad reviews.

reviews.text: I can say the Aria is on Par with the Wynn and the Bellagio which I think are the 2 best hotels I have stayed in, but you also can;t go wwrong with Caesars and Mandalay Bay.
reviews.title: Great rooms, average hotel.

reviews.text: We arrived Thursday night and got our room immediately. It was a kind size bed city view room.
reviews.title: Spoil yourself and stay somewhere really special

reviews.text: I just like the layout of the hotel, casino, and the pools are awesome. I can only say great things about the Aria.
reviews.title: Overall a good hotel, but not a great casino

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights during a conference that was going on at the Aria. My husband attended the conference, and I was tagging along for the trip. I was initially very impressed by the Aria...the building itself is gorgeous, staff was beyond helpful with the check-in process, even taking our bags and storing them for us and giving us directions to another place when we weren't ready to go to our room yet. The room was fantastic with beautiful views and was beautifully designed. Yet, there was something lacking in the hotel. It didn't feel like "Vegas" is supposed to feel. There was no excitement, it felt kind of stale. Shops are WAY overpriced here, and the pool is a bit small for the size of the hotel. We ended up going to the Bellagio and Caesar's to gamble, my husband did not care for the casino at the Aria. Oh, and one morning he went to the gym to work out between conference sessions....and was told that they would charge him $30 to GO INTO THE LOCKER ROOMS TO CHANGE CLOTHES. Seriously. Thirty dollars to change clothes. So, if you want a beautiful, comfortable place to sleep while in Vegas, this might be a good bet for you. But if you want a fun, Vegas experience, look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Stay Somewhere Else -service is horrid -Aria has no soul!!

reviews.text: We should have known upon checking in that the service would be terrible but we kept giving Aria the benefit of the doubt. The front desk staff was rude and not helpful, not even showing us a map of the grounds or how to get to the elevators. She put us in the worst room in the place, on floor 3, about a mile from the elevators and a view of the building's roof next door. None of the lighting or sound or curtains even worked automatically like our friends said their rooms did. We tried countless times to change rooms and the front desk kept saying they would honor our request but they never did. They didn't even call us back. And the countless other times I called the front desk, no one ever answered. We waited over 20 minutes in our room for our bags after the bell man said it wouldn't even be 5 minutes. We asked for a few comps, free buffet tickets, 2 for 1 drinks at the clubs, or free pool pass (which is completely normal for hotels to give out to new guests) not one was ever given to us. The resort fee is is about $30 a day and the least they could have done was comp that for our troubles, but they didn't. They did not value our money even though our group was over 10 people. I would never return to Aria.
reviews.title: If you are looking for the worst customer service on the strip, Aria's your place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the hotel, room, location, everything except the toilet. It clogged up TWICE. GROSS. Not sexy or romantic at all. Maintenance fixed, but then we were afraid of it. Guest services did remove the guest fee but seems like more should have been done. Thats a pretty messy and nasty thing to deal with. Romance killer to say the least. THE BEDS ARE TO DIE FOR!
reviews.title: Very nice, but beware of toilets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outstanding resort..fully automated room controls for curtains, lighting, HD TV, wake up feature, good- night feature (shuts down the room at bed time) all from the remote! Great wireless internet, and all kinds of goodies in the room to eat and drink...if you don't mind the pricing. The staff in the entire resort were outstanding. Wife and I had a great time at the ELVIS show and the cast was great. The resort was spotless as was the room. The food was fantastic! Congrats..to the Aria on a job WELL DONE!
reviews.title: "A #1, Top of the Heap"

reviews.text: I have stayed at several hotels in Las Vegas and Aria has the best service by far. From the moment we checked in until our departure 4 days later, I experienced excellent service. The rooms are beautiful with most comfortable beds, the room service is less than 30 minutes, and the cabana staff is top notch. The casino is large, the restaurants are excellent and even the fitness area was impressive. Each day we encountered friendly staff that made our stay very enjoyable. We were with 3 other couples and they, too, were very pleased with the hotel. This hotel definitely trained their staff well. I look forward to staying at the Aria again.
reviews.title: Fabulous Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful rooms and a great location. I really like the sound quality in the room since I never heard my neighbors. It makes for a nice quiet sleep. Downside is the minibar is really expensive and the restaurants onsite are quite pricey. Other than that, there is a Walgreens within walking distance so you can pick up food and drinks and bring them to your hotel. The pool is nice but definitely crowded (I actually prefer the Tropicana pool). My friends and I went to Haze nightclub oniste and it was fun and not overly crowded but the drinks were pricey. Overall, this is definitely the nicest hotel I have stayed at anywhere and I would recommend to anyone. Just beware of the expensive costs.
reviews.title: Quiet sleep, great view, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time to visit Aria, but many trips to Vegas. Very new feeling. Staff went above and beyond, except for the slow service in one bar. Other than that they were all friendly and very helpful. A tad back off the main strip but not a far walk. Great food and restaurants (Highly recommend Jean Georges).
reviews.title: Nice, New Feel

reviews.text: Overall amazing, if you like Modern and the New concept of Vegas, then ARIA is absolutely the hotel for you.
reviews.title: You know what they say, what happens in vegas, stays at Aria Hotel

reviews.text: Everything is gorgeous and incredible.
reviews.title: good hotel BUT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gambling is also nice, one of the lucky ones that you actually win money.* At least in my experience*
reviews.title: New Year's at Aria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel
reviews.title: New Favorite!

reviews.text: I have just returned from a three-night stay at Aria with my wife. We were there with four other friends, and agreed in unison that it was a fantastic experience.
reviews.title: Will Return...

reviews.text: Not being much of a gambler myself, I tend to focus on other aspects of the hotel experience. With that in mind, I can say with confidence I will definitely return. In fact, Aria may become our hotel of choice in Vegas (we only come once a year, so can afford to spend a little bit more).
reviews.title: You must stay at Aria!

reviews.text: From the very beginning, we were made to feel welcome. We were accommodated with a room on a higher floor without hesitation, and found the hotel staff to be generally very friendly. The high tech nature of the room was fun. I had expected stuff to go wrong, but everything worked well. The bathroom amenities were nice (they should sell them) and the bed was excellent. Good sleeps every night. Even the much complained of walk to the elevators was not that bad.
reviews.title: PG hotel in an X rated city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not eat much in the actual resort. The choices were great, but we were moving around the Strip a lot. Next time, we'll explore more. We did manage to eat at the buffet for breakfast and found it be adequate (not sure that shrimp cocktail is a breakfast meal exactly, but I decided to indulge anyway). Fortunately, we were able to use our food credit, so the price ($17.99) was not much of a concern.
reviews.title: Unbelievable Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we were frequent visitors to Vegas during the course of one year, we would probably opt for a slightly more affordable hotel. However, as we do this as an annual event, Aria was well worth the expense. We found it impressive, but still accessible and welcoming. There seemed to be a good mix of people there, which is something I always look for. When deciding where to stay, we looked at Bellagio and The Wynn, but felt we would be comfortable at Aria. It proved to be the good choice. We all look forward to staying there again in 2014.
reviews.title: Really good service, very clean and elegant rooms

reviews.text: Great place, awesome pool, and amazing room. However you know that in Vegas, you are always out on the casino floor gambling on hopes and dreams of striking it rich on the slots machines!! At least I was. They have a tasty brunch that will cure any hangover. Make sure you try the Mimosas!!
reviews.title: AAMAAZINGGG!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bedding was very comfortable! The whole room was very luxurious with remotes for the curtains, lights etc. Great Views! Loved the tub & large shower & private stall for the commode. Towels were fluffy and abundant. Staff was friendly and security was good.
reviews.title: Best Toilet Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my 2nd trip to Vegas. The first trip was to a cheaper hotel on the strip. I absolutely hated it. This time around we stayed at the Aria. What a difference :-)
reviews.title: 2nd time in Vegas was the charm

reviews.text: Accommodation's-We stayed in a non-smoking King Deluxe on the 32 floor with a beautiful view of the strip. The room size was plenty big for the 2 of us. The king size bed was nice and soft. Wi-fi worked well. Overall I was completely happy with the room.
reviews.title: What a disappointment, Aria. Expected more.

reviews.text: Smoke- The facility made the complete difference for me. As a non-smoker I find it difficult to be in clouds of smoke. With both of the trips to Vegas I have found that lower end Casino's and Hotels to have terrible ventilation. Although there is smoking on the Aria Casino floor I could generally find an area where there was no one smoking.
reviews.title: One of the best on the strip

reviews.text: You can see my last review when I stayed here... I said it before and I'll say it again - this hotel simply ROCKS!!! I have decided that I will not stay at any other hotels in Vegas besides the Aria. I am that much of a fan! From the awesome scent that you smell when you walk through the doors to the friendly staff throughout the resort, you simply can not go wrong!
reviews.title: 2nd Time here... FOR A REASON!!!

reviews.text: If I were to be extremely critical, I would have to say my only complaint about the resort is the "resort fee." But, I really can't complain about it, because it seems that this is what every major hotel is doing everywhere... You do get a lot with this fee - awesome fitness center, free wireless throughout all of City Center, etc.
reviews.title: I travel 80 days a year...and this is my favorite hotel ever!

reviews.text: Nothing else had changed since my last stay back in January, so I really can't say much more over what I have already said. Highly, highly, highly recommended!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could move in here and never leave and be one happy puppy. Upgraded to sky suite. Livingroom, dining room, bedroom, 2 bathrooms, 6 flat TVs (I lost count!), steam shower, walk in closet, high tech operations, insanely fast wifi. Everything you need and amenities you never dreamed of. The hotel even smells good. In Vegas, that is insanely important where the smell of cigarette smoke usually makes me stink and soaks into my clothing. Great restaurants, great location, great service. I am notna huge fan of Vegas, but I am already planning my next trip to this haven mid-strip.
reviews.title: Would stay there again definitely!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Aria for 3 nights. The wait for check-in can be a bit long but once checked in the rooms are great. The "electronics" take some working out but once sorted are easy to use. The hotel is clean and efficient and we ate in the hotel 2 nights and the food was superb.
reviews.title: Great Property for Fun and Value

reviews.text: I was spending the last 2 nights of a 5 night vacation solo, so I booked this 5 star hotel as a treat to myself. Total disappointment; I'll explain...
reviews.title: Not 5 star quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. They certainly do try "nickel and dime" you every step they get. I booked on Price-line and standard is a 2 bed on the site. I asked for a room with a view of the strip and that I was okay giving up the 2 beds for a 1 bed, I was told it was a $30 per night charge for this upgrade; which I was okay with. Now I am reading reviews on here, they actually charge people $30 for a room with two beds... so because I gave up my 2 beds in a room room, they actually made money because I bet they charged someone else the 30$ extra a night for the room with 2 beds I gave up, AND then I paid $30 a night for the view upgrade. If they were honest with customer service, I really should have paid nothing for the upgrade with a room with 1 bed.
reviews.title: Proof of Booking

reviews.text: 2. I went up to my room, opened the door expecting the best with the curtains opening, lights turning on, tv greeting me... NOT THE CASE! I walked into a room that was TRASHED! The room had obviously been "partied" in and not cleaned; I actually started looking around for personal belongings feeling bad I may have been intruding in someone else's room. I sat in the mess of a room on the phone for 10 minutes waiting for the front desk staff to pick up. When they finally did, I got a "sorry, this is your new room number." I then let them know I felt that this was totally unacceptable to just give me a new room being that this was to be a FIVE STAR hotel, my first impression of the room was ruined. They replied that they would give me a room upgrade however there were no suites available during my stay, They then offered a $75 food credit. So I go to the newly assigned room....
reviews.title: Amazing hotel on the strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. I entered the new room expecting this experience with being greeted by the room... again disappointment! I walked into a pitch dark room, couldn't see a thing... here again they did not live up to the 5 star standard. I then called down again now very frustrated. When I asked if they could take the $30 off per night for the strip view, I was told "No, we can't do that" REALLY??? This is where I dropped the calm attitude I had and let them have it. Their idea of fixing my first impression was re-setting the walk-in feature and having me walk outside my room and re-entering... what a joke!!
reviews.title: Beautiful but terrible for allergy sufferers!

reviews.text: When all said and done, I got a 75$ food credit, my resort fee taken off the bill, and a complimentary upgrade to a corner suite for the "next time" I say there, If I ever do again. Now take it I only got this because I opened my mouth and called them 3 times. If I had not, I highly doubt they would have done anything to make my stay better.
reviews.title: Aria has a lot of great things going for it, it’s shiny, new, perfectly pleasant. But at the end of the day it’s kind o

reviews.text: Great new hotel and casino! Very spacious and convenient! Buffet had a lot of options. This is a spot for young and old! Would definitely go back again, but the only downfall is the vanilla scented air freshener that they filter thru the building, just really got to us after a while...
reviews.title: Great new hotel and casino! Very spacious...
Great place to stay in Las Vegas.
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights at the Aria, along with another couple. The deluxe/standard rooms were roomy, very trendy, tech savvy, and comfy. I loved the architecture and decor throughout: very new with lots of glass, granite, marble; clean lines with lots of geometric detail and nothing overdone; "Zen" spaces within Las Vegas? Not all, of course--it is a casino. We ate at the Italian restaurant Sirio and food was excellent, though small servings at high prices, especially if you try the tasting menus. We wanted to try American Fish (looked great) the next night and I have also heard good things about the steakhouse, but we didn't have the chance. Our favorite place for breakfast turned out to be the Breeze--the cafe at the pool. Nice outdoor seating with views of the gardens and fresh air. Also healthy choices are available--good egg white fritatta, oatmeal, fresh fruit, pancakes. .Our friends tried the spa and exercise facilities and were very happy, but wished they had a full day to spend ($30/day) instead of the couple of hours they had. Pools are beautiful and scattered amid very attractive landscaping with some unique plants, not just the ubiquitous Las Vegas palm tree. Don't see what is so special about Liquid, the pool/bar that they try to make so exclusive. The Elvis Cirque du Soleil show looked fun, though we didn't have a chance to see it (too many good show possibilities for only two nights!). One caution I would have about the rooms is to check your privacy setting for the doors. It seems that "privacy" is a default setting, controlled by a pad near the door. We inadvertently left the privacy light on when we went out for the day, as did our friends, and neither of us got our rooms cleaned for the day! Be sure to turn on the green "service" light when you want your room made up, or they will skip you--probably saves them on maid service. Turning the light on later when we returned did not get the maid to return to clean the room. We went without clean towels and maid service--really not OK with me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was quite easy - there was a guy telling people to go to certain lines so there were no mega long queues - got a free upgrade to City View - not really a view as Veer Towers is in the way and Aria is set back from the strip.
reviews.title: Great, modern hotel but quite a walk from the strip
5 stars
reviews.text: Hotel had a nice smell in the lobby and corridors - casion wasn't very smoky which was good. Requested a non-smoking room which we got.
Room was cleanish - crumbs in the draws off the last guests and hairs in the shower - didnt' bother complaining about that.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
