reviews.text: The Aria by far is the best Las Vegas hotel I have stayed at. Their customer service is awesome, from the front desk, to the bell service and restaurants. Very impressed with the integration of technology. The floor to ceiling windows make the room and view even more spectacular. I love the bathrooms with the separate but yet combined tub and shower. Please check out Jean Philippe Patisserie on the first floor. They have some of the best pastries I have ever had.
reviews.title: You Will Not be Disappointed !!

reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel. Loved every minute of my stay.
reviews.title: Fabulous of epic proportions!

reviews.text: Stayed here with my husband for a week in April (just home), this hotel is absolutely fantastic. From the moment you walk in you get a feeling that you've arrived.
reviews.title: incredible resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From check in to check out the staff where exceptional.
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.text: The hotel is expensive though so be prepared to spend spend spend but hell who goes on holiday of this proportion to watch every bean they spend!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Aria has quickly become my favorite hotel/casino in Las Vegas. It's been around for a few years but the facility still looks terrific and the service remains great as always. Because the hotel is "eco friendly" there is a perception the quality and luxury will not be present. The rooms are laid out similar to Bellagio and Mandalay. What I think sets Aria apart is it's location and service. The staff were extremely accommodating in all aspects from front desk, security and casino floor. If possible try to book a package. They have several which give you all the nice perks of free drinks, club admittance, etc. Overall a great stay and even better hotel.
reviews.title: Best on the Strip

reviews.text: BEST room i have ever stayed in, bed and pillows were freakishly comfortable. The toilet was very grant, though the shower head was a bit weak. View was awesome, the gym was well equipped, and the restaurants were top notch. Definitely recommend to anyone going to Vegas.
reviews.title: One of the best accommodation in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I surprised my husband with a quick getaway for his milestone birthday and booked a deluxe room at Aria for the first time. We typically go to Vegas 2-3 times a year for extended stays, but this was more of a quick, impromptu trip. The Aria complex is absolutely breathtaking, so I was a little shocked when we saw the condition of our room. This resort has only been open for a short time, yet our room showed definite signs of wear and damage. There were several marks on the walls and artwork, a few stains on the bedding, and scuffs on the wood furniture. Little things in the room did not work properly: the digital scale, one of the bedside lamps, the light on the magnifying mirror in the bathroom. In this room, you really need all the lighting you can get! On first impressions, it wasn't as luxurious as I would've hoped. Nothing major - just some minor maintenance issues that could be addressed very easily. I did like the look of the tub and shower in the same area together, but the enclosed space held heat like a steam room or sauna. Nice if you're taking a shower, but a little too much for soaking in a bath. Keep a bottle of water close by if you decide to soak! The beds are everything people say they are; both the mattresses and pillows are extremely comfy! The control panel, which acts as an all-encompassing remote for the curtains, tv, lights, etc. is touchy, but a neat, more modern feature for the room. Unfortunately, it was too cold, and we were not there long enough to experience the pool, gym, or spa areas. The staff was very courteous and friendly, and even volunteered to send something special up for my husband in celebration of the occasion (though they never did). The resort is in a nice mid-strip location. Not too far from any of the other major players. All in all, I don't know if we would stay there again. We didn't experience any of the wow factors that you couldn't already experience just by passing through the Aria while gambling or dining. A different room selection might have impacted our experience, but I was hoping to use this visit to gauge whether we would enjoy longer, future stays here in a higher grade room (since we weren't planning on being in the room much this time around.)
reviews.title: Not great, not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with the other reviews that the beds are the best and the location is perfect. However when the sun shines in and the marble floor shows a build up of dust and hair which doesn't change during your 5 day stay you feel it could be cleaner. Missed the in room coffee and the fridge cannot be used to store your own water etc. as it is full of sensor linked minibar stock. Also found that our maid restocked shower gel on a daily basis even though we had not used any but after the conditioner had all gone that was it!
reviews.title: not the cleanest

reviews.text: Only average for the price I feel.
reviews.title: Great hotel & resort

reviews.text: An amazing hotel. We had a corner suite with all the bells and whistles. The automatic everything impressed us all. From the lights, to the curtains, to the Tv, all fun. I liked the Tv in the bathroom. There was a fair bit of construction in the city area with the new hotel, but Aria a great base to see Vegas. The casino was amazing, and didn't have the awful smell that most of the casinos seem to have. I think the high ceilings and the newness help with that. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Aria last week for 3 nights. From the second we entered the hotel to the second we had to leave it, it was perfection.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better!!

reviews.text: I had emailed the hotel to let them know we were celebrating an anniversary and when we arrived to check in (no long queing at all) we were told that we had been upgraded to a beautiful corner suit with a city view (not to mention a whirlpool bath,a living room, guest bathroom and 3 flat screen tvs!)
reviews.title: Decent stay at Aria

reviews.text: On our first evening we were surprised by a beautiful plate of chocolate dipped strawberries and macroons delivered to our room, with a card saying "happy anniversary". I thought it such a lovely gesture.
reviews.title: loved it!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The actual hotel interior design is beautiful, its modern, luxurious and very clean. The casino has a gorgeous smell (which i now miss!) -with honestly no smell of smoke or alcohol. The casino is just the right kind of busy- but not crazy busy which I loved. Drinks are free if you're gambling, so I took full advantage and drank champagne everynight!
reviews.title: Very accommodating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first visit to Vegas. Let me start by saying that this hotel is absolutely beautiful! They have not cut corners on the decoration anywhere, every place looks fantastic. We were first given a room on the 5th floor - I really wanted to have a room on a higher floor to enjoy the view - we agreed to change to a two queen bed room instead of our 1 king, and got a room on the 17th. The view was obviously better from up there but still not the greatest only because it was on an angle and facing the Cosmopolitain (which blocked alot). The room itself was great!! Beautifully appointed, loved the touchscreen (everyday we'd take a little pm nap and got to wake up with light music and the heavy curtain puuling back, very cool!), loved the big shower stall and that the toilet was behind a seperate glass door. The only small disappointment is not having coffee in the room - you then have to go downstairs for a cup and it starts at $4 for a small...And the fact that the maid only passed by once (always around the time we took a nap, i know thats our fault but we would've hoped she maybe would've passed by again at some other time since we ended up having our room cleaned just once the whole four nights we were there...Maybe if we had said something but we didnt bother)
reviews.title: Nice trendy spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately I cannot comment on the restaurants as we went out of the hotel complex to eat but they did look good. We did enjoy a breakfast sandwich at Jean-Philippe's though and had many drinks in the open lounge/piano bar area. When we were there a singer/musician/song-writer was there and he was sooooo good (his name escapes me now but he was a young guy with curly black hair, he sang so well and played the piano and guitar - from Elton John, to Bruno Mars to...you name it)!!! We did find that everything in the hotel was pricey - drinks about $14-$15 (mind you they were big and delicious), the blackjack tables i believe started at $20, etc. but oh well, we weren't going with a strict budget in mind so it was ok. We did go to Liquid one day (the VIP pool area - costs $40 to get in, but you can usually find free passes - when we went they were handing some out right before the entrance) - it was cool as you felt pampered (personal waiter) and had lots of room, comfy lounge chairs (note if you want a chair, you need to commit to spend at least $50 (each) which seemed a bit steep at first but when you look at the prices, it really only takes about two drinks and a bite to eat to ge there, lol), but we went to the "regular pools" the other days and felt it was almost as good (the waiters were still coming right to your chair and didnt take too too long). The hotel is pretty well situated on the strip (note though, everything in Vegas is a bit of a walk because of the size of the hotels so even if you're going just two hotels down, it'll take you a bit to get there so bring comfy shoes!!!) All in all we thouroughly enjoyed our stay and we'd recommend the place if you're looking for a swankier type of hotel. Of all the places we walked through, we felt like we had picked the nicest :)
reviews.title: Nice hotel but by no means a 5 star hotel

reviews.text: Ok...This is a nice hotel and I have stayed at the Aria several times, but by no means is this a 5 star hotel! I think the people who are in charge of giving this hotel 5 stars, better re-evaluate their decision.
reviews.title: Wow a bit high tech

reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel on 6/8/12 and it took me at least 2 hours to check in!! The line was huge because their computer system crashed. I waited longer in line than the flight and taxi ride combined! They offered me no compesation until I asked, then they offered me $75.00. I was able to talk them into $100.00 resort credit. And this is how a 5 star resort treats it's guests!!
reviews.title: Love, love, love this hotel!

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, I like the Aria and will most likely stay there again, but I have to say, I was quite impressed with the the looks of the Wynn hotel. I have not stayed there before, but it looks like a 5 star hotel. I will try it next time I visit Vegas, just because the way I was treated at Aria. I'm sure many people who experienced what I did at the Aria will agree with me.
reviews.title: Luxury, very close yet kind of far from strip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were very nice and cozy. However, I stayed two nights and they never cleaned the room once. I had to call for towels. I could not believe it. As expensive as this place was for them not to clean the room is crazy. Also, if you like an $11 glass of beer or a $16 hot dog, this is your place. Everything is way overpriced. Vegas has way to many options that are priced better and has better service. Stay away.
reviews.title: House keeping?

reviews.text: The rooms are great and the bed and pillows are amazing. The decor of the hotel, the restaurents, the bars and casino is very chic and very modern. Each area has its own unique look.  Staff at the concierge is super helpful I booked all shows and restaurants (to other hotels) with them. We loved to go and see more grandiose casinos like the Caesar or the Venetian but in the end, we prefer staying at the Aria. Hotel location is perfect.
reviews.title: Great modern casino

reviews.text: Me and my friends stayed here last week for 5 nights. I have to stay the check in experience started things off wrong. The front desk clerk was uninterested at satisfying the customer and took the liberty to book on floor 38 when we had requested to stay near friends on floor 11. She tried to tell us there was nothing closer, but after I demanded her to look into it she found something on floor 12...amazing isn't it?
reviews.title: Customer Service is Terrible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next is the Cafe Vetto...this place is just horrible! The worst experince I've had in any restaurant...ever!
reviews.title: Nice but not quite 5 star

reviews.text: The first time around it took forever to get my food (about 40 mins at 2 am), and when the food arrived, it was cold as ice! When the manager arrived, instead of him listening to my complaint, he threatened to call security. I guess he thought he was going to treat me like another drunk or something. I obliged on the security offer and got things all squared off.
reviews.title: My Favorite in Vegas

reviews.text: The hotel was super nice. Very modern, and the rooms were techy. Awesome drinks at every bar in the Casino area. The Elements store on the main level sells everything you may have forgotten at home. Great, friendly staff... and every time we found ourselves needing assistance with something related to our stay, we were rewarded with efficient people giving excellent customer service. The hotel was obviously very well-managed. Additionally, every staff member that we came accross in the hallways of the hotel gave a friendly smile and told us to have a great day. Obviously they've put some effort into ensuring a good customer experience, and having the staff say hello is a great gesture. Aria really is going above and beyond, and it definitely doesn't go unnoticed.
reviews.title: Best Sleep EVER

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here for business, and the conference rooms were really nice. Wonderful space for group presentations.
reviews.title: above a 5 Star. No where better in Vegas!

reviews.text: I have to give special mention to the beds in the hotel rooms at Aria. I have never slept so well ever in my life. We've stayed at many nice hotels, but the beds/pillows/duvets at Aria astounded us with their luxury. Two thumbs up to Aria!
reviews.title: High Tech Room, Nice Hotel, Very Pricey Restaurants, OK Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have had to write this review...I only got back from Vegas yesterday!
reviews.title: Excellent Experience in the corner suite!

reviews.text: First time visting Las Vegas and it was amazing. At first glance, all the hotels looked out of this world. We stayed 4 nights in a Bellagio suite and we thought we were in heaven.
reviews.title: Not worth the price of the hype

description: ARIA Resort & Casino is a AAA Five Diamond Award winning resort which offers you the best in accommodations, gaming, dining and entertainment. Check out the newest place to see and be seen on the Las Vegas Strip.
